name: Cults
description:
'''Cults''' is an American [[indie pop]] band formed in [[New York City]] in 2010, comprising multi-instrumentalists Madeline Follin and Brian Oblivion. The band first rose to prominence after the release of their debut extended play, ''Cults 7"'' (2010), which was released on their [[Bandcamp]] page. They signed with English singer [[Lily Allen]]'s record label [[In the Name Of (record label)|In the Name Of]], an imprint of [[Sony Music]], to release their [[Cults (album)|eponymous debut studio album]] (2011). Their song "Bad Things" was sampled by American rapper [[J. Cole]] for his 2013 single "[[She Knows (J. Cole song)|She Knows]]", on which they were credited as featured artists.

The band has since released another four albums: [[Static (Cults album)|''Static'']] (2013), ''[[Offering (Cults album)|Offering]]'' (2017), ''[[Host (Cults album)|Host]]'' (2020) and ''To The Ghosts'' (2024), as well as an [[EP]]: Motels (2018).
